title: League crashing after new windows update
body: The other night, Windows 10 performed an update.  After attempting to start a game of League, my computer crashes on the loading screeIn.  When I played with some friends, I got into loading screen and my computer crashed again.  I had to do a hard reset as it just freezes on loading screen.  Can't alt+tab, ctrl+alt+delete, nothin.  Really frustrating.  Is it something to do with my League not cooperating with the new update?  I attempted to do a repair, but that did nothing to fix the issue.

replies.body:
Worked for me.

Disabling Xbox GameBar
1. Open the XBox app.
2. Click on the Settings icon on the left.
3. Click on the Game DVR.
4. Under Record game clips and screenshots using Game DVR, turn the toggle to right to turn On Game bar.
5. Turn the toggle left to turn Off Game bar.

It sounds like your game is failing to render properly, which could be happening for a few reasons.  Some players have reported similiar occurnces after a Windows 10 update, and it turns out that the [Xbox Game Bar ](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) bar was causing the problem.  Disabling that could help!  

Some third party programs that interact with league have been causing issues as well.  If you have any apps running like Play.tv or Overwolf, remove them.

Also make sure to update any drivers, which is especially important after an update.  If all else fails, go over our [game crash](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974-Bug-Splat-and-Game-Crashes+) guide for a list of steps to fix up game crashes and bug splats.

Hope all of that helps!
